TextView.android:text: Congrats your Emission is in low level, keep it up!!
To decrease you carbon emission, you can do the following :
House Emission
In Electricity:
Turn off all lights and electronics when not in use or use smart power strips to avoid vampire loads. Switch to LED bulbs and energy-efficient appliances and products.
Switch to LED bulbs and energy-efficient appliances and products.
In Charcoal:
Consider switching to cleaner cooking fuels like LPG gas, biogas, or improved cookstoves with lower emissions. If charcoal is essential, use it sparingly and only for specific tasks.
Use efficient cooking methods like pressure cookers, cover pots while cooking, and avoid unnecessary preheating.
In Firewood:
Start with small kindling and build the fire gradually. Use proper airflow to maintain a hot, clean-burning fire. Avoid using accelerants like gasoline, which release harmful toxins.
Match the fireplace or stove size to the firewood length and amount. Overfilling can suffocate the fire and lead to incomplete combustion, increasing emissions.
In LPG:
Use the right size pots for your burners and keep the lid on while cooking. Check for leaks in your pipes, burners, and regulators and fix them as soon as possible
Check for leaks in your pipes, burners, and regulators and fix them as soon as possible
Food Emission
In Meat:
Eat Less Meat: Cutting back on meat consumption, particularly processed and red meats, is one of the best methods to reduce the carbon emissions associated with eating meat.
Reduce the amount of food waste generated with meat by conserving and using leftovers. This saves money and resources in addition to lowering carbon emissions.
In Fish:
Buy locally sourced fish to significantly reduce the transportation-related carbon footprint. In addition to lowering emissions from long-distance shipping, this also support local fishermen..
Rather than going for larger predatory fish like tuna or swordfish, eat smaller fish lower on the food chain like sardines or mackerel, as they typically have lower carbon footprints.
In Crustaceans:
Choose crustaceans that are in season and sourced locally whenever possible.This reduces the carbon emissions associated with long-distance transportation and refrigeration.

Steer clear of energy-intensive cooking techniques like deep-frying or frying and instead use techniques like grilling or steaming. Using energy-efficient appliances can also help cut carbon emissions even more..
In Mollusks:

Select mollusks from sustainable sources: Seek out mollusks that have been harvested or farmed responsibly. The production of mollusks can have a smaller environmental impact if sustainable methods are used.

Purchasing mollusks from local suppliers helps lessen the transportation-related carbon footprint. Seafood that is obtained locally frequently uses less energy in transit than seafood that is imported from a great distance away.
Vehicle Emission
In Vehicle:
Combine errands into fewer trips, avoid rush hour traffic, and choose direct routes to minimize distance driven.
For short trips and errands, consider ditching the car and opting for greener alternatives. Walking and cycling are not only emission-free but also provide health benefits.
Travel Emission
In Travel:
Plan your errands efficiently to minimize the number of public transport journeys you take.
For smaller trips within walking or biking distance, ditch the bus or train and get some exercise!
